The Impact of Digital Platforms on our Cinematic Consumption üì∫ Last evening, I took a nostalgic dive into my DVD collection, opting for a familiar film. The joy of revisiting "The Pursuit of Happyness" was unparalleled. No sensationalism, no crimes nor sex, just a heartfelt narrative and stellar performances. The film beautifully captures Chris Gardner's transformation from homelessness to success, highlighting the sacrifices he and his son made along the way. Reflecting on this, I recognized a shift in our cinematic consumption. Digital platforms, with their endless catalogs, have changed how we engage with movies. The ease of hopping from one title to another often means we don't fully appreciate or critically evaluate what we watch. In earlier times, subpar movies would naturally fade from theaters and public memory. Today, while platforms like Netflix have given us gems, there's also an influx of average content. The essence of film critique seems lost amidst this digital deluge. We must ponder: Is the convenience of streaming diluting the depth of our cinematic experiences? #FilmCritique #StreamingPlatforms #Netflix #Disney+ #PrimeVideo
